pullrequest.title: More examples: install, create core library, find dependency, check pkg-config requires

content.raw:
This is a warning that gets triggered in all our ignition projects' Windows builds. It's caused by passing the `/GL` flag to a build that also has some debug flags (i.e. `RelWithDebInfo`). Some debug flags seem to automatically trigger `/INCREMENTAL`, which conflicts with `/GL`.

I've attempted to suppress this warning by explicitly adding `/INCREMENTAL:NO` to our command line flags, but that didn't seem to help. As far as I can tell, the only way to prevent this warning from printing is to not use `/GL` on our `RelWithDebInfo` builds. I don't know enough about linker optimization to judge whether that's a good, bad, or neutral idea.
content.html:
This is a warning that gets triggered in all our ignition projects' Windows builds. It's caused by passing the /GL flag to a build that also has some debug flags (i.e. RelWithDebInfo). Some debug flags seem to automatically trigger /INCREMENTAL, which conflicts with /GL.

I've attempted to suppress this warning by explicitly adding /INCREMENTAL:NO to our command line flags, but that didn't seem to help. As far as I can tell, the only way to prevent this warning from printing is to not use /GL on our RelWithDebInfo builds. I don't know enough about linker optimization to judge whether that's a good, bad, or neutral idea.
